articles.title: Experts Who Warn of Risks Posed by Chinese Students Are Skeptical of Trump Plan
articles.description: Some former spy-hunters see the State Department’s plan to revoke visas of some Chinese college students as heavy-handed and counterproductive.
articles.content: The F.B.I. has spent decades investigating some professors and students from China suspected of using their studies to secretly spy for their home country. As the Trump administration tries a new, more aggressive effort to stop such activity, experts... [952 chars]

articles.title: Polish presidential candidates neck and neck on eve of runoff vote
articles.description: National tensions over future of Poland play out in Siekierczyn, where a single vote determined the first round
articles.content:
Poles will cast their votes on Sunday in the closest presidential runoff since the fall of communism, in an election that pits two different visions of the nation against each other.
In Poland’s previous election in 2020, the conservative populist in... [7159 chars]

articles.title: Pete Hegseth calls on Asia to boost military spending in face of ‘imminent’ threat from China
articles.description: Speaking at the Shangri-la Dialogue in Singapore, the US defence secretary outlined a rang of new joint projects in the region
articles.content:
The US secretary of defence has called on Asian countries to boost their military spending to increase regional deterrence against China, which was “rehearsing for the real deal” when it comes to taking over Taiwan.

articles.title: Pete Hegseth says Chinese military action against Taiwan ‘could be imminent’
articles.description: US defence secretary warns in Singapore that Beijing’s actions in Asia are ‘wake-up call’ for America’s allies
articles.content:

articles.title: Trump’s mass firings at several agencies will remain on hold, appeals court rules
articles.description: President Donald Trump’s directives for mass firings at multiple agencies will remain on hold, a federal appeals court ruled Friday evening
articles.content:
CNN —
President Donald Trump’s directives for mass firings at multiple agencies will remain on hold, a federal appeals court ruled Friday evening.
The Trump administration had asked the US 9th Circuit Court of Appeals to freeze a lower court’s order ... [3529 chars]

articles.title: Trump Administration Ends Program Critical to Search for an H.I.V. Vaccine
articles.description: The termination is the latest in a series of cuts to H.I.V. research and programs to prevent the disease.
articles.content:
The Trump administration has dealt a sharp blow to work on H.I.V. vaccines, terminating a $258 million program whose work was instrumental to the search for a vaccine.
Officials from the H.I.V. division of the National Institutes of Health delivered ... [589 chars]

articles.title: Appeals court denies Trump administration's request to resume mass firings of federal employees
articles.description: The White House had sought an emergency stay of an injunction issued by U.S. Judge Susan Illston of San Francisco in a lawsuit brought by labor unions and cities, including San Francisco and Chicago.
articles.content:
An appeals court on Friday refused to freeze a California judge's order halting the Trump administration from downsizing the federal workforce, which means that Department of Government Efficiency-led cuts remain on pause for now.
In the 2-1 ruling, ... [1793 chars]

articles.title: "Supremely Talented Actor"
articles.description: Alan Alda paid tribute to his longtime 'M*A*S*H' co-star Loretta Swit, who died May 30: "A supremely talented actor" who "made the most of her time here."
articles.content:
Alan Alda, who starred on CBS’ long-running comedy series M*A*S*H alongside Loretta Swit, spoke out Friday after the news of Swit’s death at age 87.
Swit, who played Major Margaret “Hot Lips” Houlihan on all 11 seasons of M*A*S*H from 1972-1983, died... [1509 chars]

articles.title: 'Blacklisted' Crew Sues for Sexual Harassment
articles.description: Three crew members on 'Doctor Odyssey' claim they were victims of on-set sexual harassment and were fired after complaining to management.
articles.content:
Three former crewmembers on the ABC medical series “Doctor Odyssey” are suing 20th Century and its parent company Disney for allegedly enabling an “unchecked campaign of sexual harassment for months” on the set of the series.

articles.title: Appeals court keeps block on the Trump administration’s workforce cuts
articles.description: An appeals court is keeping in place a court block on the Trump administration’s downsizing of the federal workforce. The order was issued Friday.
